# Constitution Amendment Proposal

**Status**: Draft | **Target Version Bump**: (MAJOR|MINOR|PATCH) | **Date**: <!-- YYYY-MM-DD -->

## 1. Context
Describe the current state and why an amendment is needed. Link to relevant discussions, incidents, or retrospectives.

## 2. Problem Statement
Concise articulation of the gap, risk, or barrier (e.g., security ambiguity, governance inefficiency, missing clarity).

## 3. Proposed Change
Exact wording additions/modifications/removals to the constitution. Use block quotes or diff-like formatting if large.

## 4. Principles Affected
List impacted principles (Transparency, Security, Privacy, Community & Governance, etc.) and describe nature of impact.

## 5. Version Bump Justification
Explain why this is MAJOR (breaking/removal), MINOR (new/expanded), or PATCH (clarification only).

## 6. Risk & Mitigation
Identify risks (operational, security, contributor confusion) and how each will be mitigated.

## 7. Migration / Transition Plan
Steps to adopt: communication method, tooling updates, template changes, training, sunset of old practice.

## 8. Communication Plan
Channels (release notes, roadmap update, blog/newsletter) + timing. Point of contact for questions.

## 9. Fast-Track Justification (ONLY if emergency)
Explain active exploitation or urgent compliance need. Include planned retrospective follow-up issue reference.

## 10. Success Metrics
How we will validate the amendment achieved its purpose (e.g., reduced incident count, faster onboarding, fewer ambiguities).

## 11. Reversal Criteria
Conditions under which this change would be rolled back or revised.

## 12. Stakeholder Approvals
- Maintainer(s): <!-- names -->
- Security Steward (if security/privacy touched): <!-- name or N/A -->
- Other reviewers: <!-- names or N/A -->

## 13. Implementation Checklist
- [ ] Constitution text updated
- [ ] Version bumped
- [ ] Roadmap / changelog updated
- [ ] Templates adjusted (if required)
- [ ] Communication published
- [ ] Metrics tracking updated (if applicable)

---
**Reminder**: Minimum 7-day public discussion window unless marked emergency (requires retrospective). Supporting docs (SECURITY.md, GOVERNANCE.md) must reflect accepted changes.
